decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to utilize the Adventure mechanic to quickly put pressure on the opponent and maintain card advantage. By using cards like Edgewall Innkeeper, Lucky Clover, and Fae of Wishes, the deck aims to consistently generate value and tempo. Beanstalk Giant and Nissa, Who Shakes the World provide powerful ramp and late-game threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant to control the board. Overall, the deck is focused on being proactive and efficient, overwhelming the opponent with a combination of speed and versatility.

The main concept of the deck is to use a combination of aggressive creatures like Cavalier of Dawn, Brazen Borrower, and Dream Trawler to put pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deputy of Detention. The deck also utilizes flicker effects from cards like Thassa, Deep-Dwelling and Charming Prince to generate value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Agent of Treachery and Elspeth Conquers Death helps to close out games quickly. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent color access for the deck's powerful spells.

The main focus of this Bant Control deck is to utilize powerful planeswalkers and removal spells to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World providing card advantage and tempo advantage, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping into big threats like Hydroid Krasis and Dream Trawler. The deck also utilizes cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Shatter the Sky to remove important threats from the board and maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, along with board wipes like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death. It also utilizes card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales, while ramping up with Growth Spiral and mana dorks. The win condition comes from big threats like Dream Trawler, Hydroid Krasis, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan, gain value through card advantage, and overwhelm with powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers and control spells to manage the game and maintain board control. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's strategy, and ramping with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to generate mana advantages, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. With a mix of removal, card advantage engines, and efficient threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis, the deck aims to slowly grind the opponent down while never running out of resources.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Teferi, along with board wipes like Shatter the Sky. It also aims to ramp up mana quickly with Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, while gaining card advantage through Narset and Uro. The deck includes threats like Dream Trawler and Hydroid Krasis to close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements, allowing for consistent casting of spells and maximizing the value of each card played.

The deck focuses on using control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up mana and card advantage with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. It also includes efficient removal like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death to deal with threats. The deck aims to establish board dominance with big threats like Hydroid Krasis and Dream Trawler, eventually overwhelming the opponent with value and card advantage. It also includes cards like Dovin's Veto and Aether Gust to protect its own game plan and maintain control of the board.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the game with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion. Kenrith, the Returned King provides versatility and utility, while God-Eternal Oketra and Cavalier of Flame offer big threats to close out the game. The deck also includes card selection and recursion with cards like Sphinx of Foresight and Elspeth Conquers Death. By managing the board and utilizing the free casting provided by Fires of Invention, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with powerful spells and creatures while utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells in a turn without using mana. By playing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion, the deck aims to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy is to generate advantage through card advantage and tempo plays, eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King. The deck's strength lies in its ability to effectively control the game and dictate the pace of play.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while also using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes big threats like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. The deck also has a solid mana base with a mix of lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana needed for the spells.

The deck is built around the strategy of controlling the board with powerful removal spells and creatures while utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free. Cards like Deafening Clarion and Aether Gust help control the opponent's board, while Bonecrusher Giant and Cavalier of Flame provide strong threats. The deck also has card draw and selection with Sphinx of Foresight and Kenrith, the Returned King. Teferi, Time Raveler is included for disruption and tempo advantage, making it difficult for the opponent to interact effectively. Fast and efficient gameplay is the main focus of this archetype.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells and creatures for free, while controlling the board with cards like Deafening Clarion and Teferi, Time Raveler. The key strategy is to establish board control early on with removal spells and then overwhelm the opponent with large threats like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King. Additionally, cards like Sphinx of Foresight and Cavalier of Gales help with card selection and manipulation. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building a strong board presence to secure victory.

Utilizing Fires of Invention to cast high-impact spells for free while controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion. The deck focuses on stabilizing the board early with Bonecrusher Giant and Cavalier of Flame, then overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats like Cavalier of Gales and Kenrith, the Returned King. The deck also features card advantage engines like Sphinx of Foresight and Elspeth Conquers Death to maintain control over the game. Strategic land choices and sideboard options help improve consistency and adaptability against various matchups.

This deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast spells for free, allowing the player to efficiently control the game and overpower their opponent. The deck includes powerful cards like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King to apply pressure while controlling the board with removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Deafening Clarion. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Sphinx of Foresight and Castle Vantress provide card selection and manipulation. Overall, the deck aims to gain control of the game and win through powerful threats and efficient spell casting.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive green creatures in order to quickly overpower the opponent. The key strategy involves playing efficient and powerful creatures such as Yorvo, Lord of Garenbrig, Questing Beast, and Lovestruck Beast to quickly build a threatening board presence. The deck also includes supporting cards like Paradise Druid and Pelt Collector to ramp up mana and grow the creatures. Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Nissa, Who Shakes the World provide additional ways to buff creatures and generate advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of powerful green creatures.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and sacrifice synergies. By utilizing cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Mayhem Devil, the deck can generate value from sacrificing creatures while also dealing damage to the opponent. Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger provides additional pressure and disruption, while Tymaret Calls the Dead helps fill the graveyard and provide additional creatures. The deck also includes some card draw and sacrifice outlets to maintain resources and apply constant pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays using creatures that can sacrifice to activate powerful abilities. Utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn and Witch's Oven, the deck aims to control the board while steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total. The key synergy lies in sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Mire Triton to trigger effects like Mayhem Devil's ping damage or Kroxa's escape ability. By applying constant pressure and generating value from sacrifices, this deck aims to outpace and outlast the opponent in a fast-paced match.

This deck aims to aggressively control the board by using sacrifice synergies with cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Woe Strider. The strategy involves stealing opponent's creatures with Claim the Firstborn and sacrificing them for value. Priest of Forgotten Gods provides additional sacrifice outlets and card advantage. Mayhem Devil punishes opponents for sacrificing creatures, while Rankle, Master of Pranks and Dreadhorde Butcher offer additional sources of damage and disruption. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive playstyle and the recurring threats it can generate.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with spells like Growth Spiral and Wolfwillow Haven to cast powerful threats like Nissa, Nightpack Ambusher, and Hydroid Krasis. It utilizes counterspells like Sinister Sabotage and Frilled Mystic to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to create a board presence early in the game and maintain pressure on the opponent with a mix of card advantage, tempo plays, and efficient threats. Castle Vantress provides additional late-game value, while cards like Aether Gust and Mystical Dispute help against opposing threats and spells.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Arborial Grazer and Ilysian Caryatid, while utilizing powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to overwhelm opponents with big threats. The deck also includes removal spells like Murderous Rider and Casualties of War to deal with opposing threats, along with card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and The Great Henge to maintain momentum. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and pressure opponents with a combination of efficient threats and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Aether Gust and Thought Erasure, while also ramping up mana with Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by playing powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis, as well as generating card advantage with Cavalier of Thorns. Additionally, Casualties of War provides a versatile removal option to deal with multiple types of permanents on the opponent's side of the board.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful threats. By utilizing cards like Thought Erasure to disrupt the opponent's game plan, and ramp spells like Growth Spiral to accelerate your mana, you can set up for big plays like playing Nissa, Who Shakes the World or casting Casualties of War to swing the game in your favor. The deck's flexible mana base allows for smooth gameplay and the ability to cast powerful multicolor spells consistently.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful removal spells like Casualties of War and Aether Gust, while also ramping into big threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thought Erasure, and generate card advantage with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Cavalier of Thorns. The mana base is designed to support all three colors efficiently, allowing the deck to consistently cast its powerful spells.

The main idea of this Sultai Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using various removal spells and hand disruption, while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral to play big threats like Nissa, Hydroid Krasis, and Uro. Casualties of War serves as a versatile removal spell that can get rid of multiple threats at once. The deck aims to control the board and out-value the opponent with its powerful late-game threats, while also maintaining a good mana base with a mix of lands that provide all three colors needed for the deck.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal while utilizing cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Expansion / Explosion to generate card advantage and maintain tempo. The deck aims to efficiently answer threats and gain incremental advantages until it can establish a dominating board presence with powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nightpack Ambusher. Through a combination of card draw, tempo plays, and powerful finishers, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a battle of attrition.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation to generate a large amount of mana and control the game with powerful spells like Storm's Wrath and Expansion / Explosion. With a mix of counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Negate, as well as card draw and removal spells, the deck aims to maintain board control while setting up for a big finish with Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Brazen Borrower. The key strategy is to control the game tempo and overwhelm the opponent with versatile spells and powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells while also ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral. Its key strategy involves generating card advantage with Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and using powerful finishers like Nightpack Ambusher and Expansion / Explosion to close out the game. The deck also includes some tempo plays with Brazen Borrower and Spectral Sailor to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides a powerful threat that can gain life and card advantage. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Expansion / Explosion and Ral's Outburst. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the three colors of the deck, allowing for consistent casting of spells and ensuring a stable mana base throughout the game.

This deck focuses on using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game. It utilizes cards like Narset, Teferi, and Elspeth Conquers Death to limit the opponent's options and generate value over time. The deck also includes sweepers like Shatter the Sky to deal with threats on the board. Its win conditions are Dream Trawler and Archon of Sun's Grace, which can provide an overwhelming advantage once the opponent's resources are depleted. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to the colored mana needed for its spells.

This deck focuses on using control elements to prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively. Cards like Absorb, Dovin's Veto, and Mystical Dispute allow for countering opponent spells, while cards like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death help control the board. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to generate card advantage and control the game. The win condition of the deck is Dream Trawler, a powerful flyer that can provide card advantage and close out games quickly.
